16. WRAPPINGS AND CONTAINERS

Mention any changes which you recall in the wrappings and containers received with the food you purchased (give dates where possible).

The tea came in tin cans usual 3 lb lot.

17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the approximate month, e.g., winter or summer.

Breakfast: rolled oat porridge, bacon, eggs, toast and jam, tea or milk.

Dinner: roast beef, potato, carrots, other vegetables, pudding, or pie, tea or milk.

Supper: soup, potatoes, eggs, meat of some kind, fruit, bread, butter, cake, cookies, tea.

18. What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in Eastern Canada?

Give the menu. List those present and give their approximate ages at that time.

Dinner: roast chicken and dressing, gravy, can corn, pickles, bread & butter, plum pudding and sauce, mince pie, candy & nuts.

People in the house: Mr. & Mrs. Percy Smith, sisters Kitty & Willie Wrightman, brother John Wrightman.

Mrs. Percy Smith, minister.

To far from town now to rely on prepared foods yet to much snow and bad roads 11 miles from without the nearest town.
